text: Dalton Jérson Trevisan (14 June 1925 – 9 December 2024) was a Brazilian writer. He wrote many short stories. Most of them were popular dramas." Trevisan won the 2012 Prémio Camões. He was born in Curitiba, Brazil. He was nicknamed "The Vampire of Curitiba" because he did not like to go out in public and for living a long life. Only two of his books have been translated into English, Novels Not at All Exemplary and The Vampire of Curitiba, both in 1972. Trevisan died in Curitiba on 9 December 2024 at the age of 99. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Projeto Releitura (in Portuguese) * Oxford Anthology of the Brazilian Short Story Category:1925 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Brazilian novelists Category:People from Curitiba
